Node.definition: = a relatively large quantity of liquid flowing with strength
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

Node.gloss: to cause (someone's) heart to turn|to cause (someone) to focus their attention
Node.definition: literally: to cause (someone's) heart to turn aside; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to focus their thoughts and attention on a person, deity or activity
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= state in which an event is considered superior in quality to other events
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= state in which humans are ready and prepared to act when needed
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation
= state in which humans feel pressed to act quickly; ≈ often associated with a lack of wisdom
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well being
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= process by which the wind causes objects to be moved from one place to the other
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= causative action by which humans remove objects from their place with force
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= practices that conform to the laws of God
literally: (one's way is) crooked; hence: = state in which the behavior of humans is morally and/or ethically unacceptable
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
exact meaning unknown; possibly: = state in which the behavior of humans is considered morally and ethically unacceptable
literally: pure; hence: = state in which an event is considered without fault
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= the structure forming the upper covering of a building, usually built as a terrace, to which one goes up by stairs
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state of being associated with other people for a common purpose

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= to experience a desire to see something happen or to do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

Node.gloss: to make wise|to give understanding|to instruct
Node.definition: = causative action or process by which humans, deities, or plants cause humans to have the ability to understand things
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to consider|to ponder|to observe|to take note of|to have regard for|to give heed to|to study
Node.definition: = action by which humans think about someone or something accompanied by a willingness to translate their conclusions into action if needed
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= to cover part of the body so that it cannot perform some function
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= object given to someone else
= state in which knowledge, an object, or an action is kept hidden or unknown from others
= causative process by which one event causes another event not to take place
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person
literally: (in/from one's) bosom; hence: = a state in which an event is unknown to others
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= state in which a state is very intense
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lack inner strength and courage
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= causative action by which humans cause (other) humans or deities to experience displeasure ◄ by their words or behavior
= valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well being
= state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to bring down; = causative action by which humans cause a construction to collapse to be taken apart
literally: strength; hence: = a construction that is strong and able to resist attacks
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

Node.gloss: to be careful|to make sure|to take precautions
Node.definition: = action by which humans ensure their own well being by being watchful, by making sure that certain instructions are carried out, or by refraining from certain activities
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, aggression, and rebellion against God
= pertaining to a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly, especially with one's mouth; ≈ seen as a condition that cannot last
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to do; hence; = action by which humans and engaged in a specific activity, usually in the service of someone else
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= to experience a desire to see something happen or to do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion
literally: plan; hence: = a state of moral and ethical corruption, starting with evil plans and resulting in depraved practices, ≈ regarded as foolishness
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to put on a bold face
Node.definition: literally: to cause one's face to be strong; hence: = action by which humans wear a bold expression on their face ► in order to give other people the impression that they feel confident
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
